Author: alperC#7758
Content: everyone We'll be holding an AMA on Discord about AtomicDEX on Wednesday, 7th August, 5 PM UTC

Author: alperC#7758
Content:
ADD THIS AMA TO YOUR CALENDAR - https://evt.mx/MxFL58Ly 

A few weeks ago, we've launched one of two new flagship products, the AtomicDEX. Because the feedback has been overwhelmingly positive, we‚Äôve decided to hold an AMA. You can ask the team anything regarding more information about the development, timelines, future plans for AtomicDEX and so on.

We are asking our community to post their questions in this channel, and we'll choose the most popular ones based on how many Ôøº‚¨Ü  each question receives. We will also answer questions live, if time permits.

Author: mrtzmp3#2896
Content: Will you incentive traders for making many trades ? I am thinking a lottery where your amount of trades are entry tickets for some kind of pricepool , example taken from the fees ? Or even more cheap trading fees , like for owning bnb on binance ?

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @mrtzmp3 with the market maker bot the team is making that connects to CEX, traders will get a bot that will do arb at whatever the user sets as their profit margin

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Free money is a good incentive üòÉ

Author: mrtzmp3#2896
Content: Wow

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Now think about someone that sets profit at 5%. So whatever they can buy on the centralized exchanges (market buy), on the dex it will be market price +5%

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: This guys starts to make money

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Now i see this guy making money without doing much, set and forget and re-balance funds when needed.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Now i like free money and i set my bot to do price + 4.9% instead

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Now i am the guy making 5% and i see this guy under cutting me, i either find another pair that the 4.9 guy is not doing or  i under cut him 4.8%

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Now image we have instead of 2 people we have 200 people under cutting each other to get the free money

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: The market will then figure out who will keep providing the liquidity at the lowest fee  and there will be a balance

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: This is like the bitcoin hash rate going up. For a period of time when the hash is too high and profits not enough to justify it, some miners back off so the remaining miners get more, then when it is profitable again they jump back in. Market will self regulate

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: But at the end of the day, we will be the most liquid DEX ever.

Author: crumb#2550
Content:
are there specific plans in place to have good liquidity for when AtomicDEX is out and usable for everyone? i read that there are plans to use CEX API-s to enable more liquidity. is that for some more distant future or will this be ready once AtomicDEX is launched?
so basically what i'm asking is: what specific steps are being taken to provide as much liquidity as possible?

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: If 5 different projects are using the AtomicDEX backend for their own DEX, is KMD given the same 10% discount automatically or can they choose not to use the discount?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
@crumb afaik, marketmakers via CLI can already integrate CEX APIs if they code in the neccessary calls to replenish their funds after an order has matched. I'll be testing this myself using python next week.
@yorklab I guess certain 3rd party projects may decide to not pass on the discount, but that would meke them less competitive so it would be a silly thing to do.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: discounted fee is part of the protocol

Author: crumb#2550
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator my question was not **if** those things could be done, but more about if there are arrangements/deals with parties in place to provide more liquidity

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we are creating automated marketmakers anybody can use

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not involved on the deal side, but i heard some potential deals are also in the works, but of course that relies on third parties. when everybody can be a marketmaker and make relatively risk free 5% arbitrage, i think that since people like money, we will get people to do that

Author: crumb#2550
Content: marketing/PR/communications team should prepare articles and guides to make this as easy as possible and shout it from the rooftops. this kind of stuff is gold for social media efforts

Author: crumb#2550
Content: tech has never been an issue in KMD ecosystem üòÑ

Author: alperC#7758
Content:
everyone, thank you for your questions and participation in our AMA about atomicDEX. We have collected all questions, answered them individually and summarized them in a Google Docs. 

You can read it here:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ah6CtIsDlL9JVKoQk2vd43h8ugtKDZta3Nn4khnbObU/edit?usp=sharing

If you have any other questions drop it here, our team will answer them live for the next 30 minutes.

Author: cyrelb#6993
Content: Do we have access to our private keys from the wallet?

Author: Audo#5667
Content: yes, the seed you use can be transformed into a privatekey format. The seed is also compatible with Verus Agama (for example)

Author: ca333#0118
Content: and it is accessible from within atomicDEX mobile - visit Settings->View Seed

Author: cyrelb#6993
Content: But for BTC for example? Do we have to install Verus Agam and the PK is derived from the seed?

Author: Camilo Lopez#8651
Content: Can you do offchain swaps orders? Because you need internet access to executed the swap. What about be able to open an order offline and execute after been online.

Author: Smedley#8094
Content: Will coin communities that have a big userbase but lack being a base trading pair on exchanges be contacted to possibly create their own version of atomicdex with their coin as a base pairing? Coins such as dash or dogecoin. This could set the Komodo atomic swap protocol as the baseline of atomic swaps bringing more people into the komodo ecosystem.

Author: alperC#7758
Content: @cyrelb so you asking if you can access your key for a specific coin ?

Author: ca333#0118
Content: There are many options to transform the Seed to any coins private key in the wallet import format. I believe Verus Agama has this feature. There are many other tools available (like https://github.com/iancoleman/bip39) for this task since we follow the BIP39 standard @cyrelb -  https://github.com/DeckerSU/address_gen is an option which is trusted and Agama seed compatible.
